newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX natgas ends mixed, Jan sets new high on cold.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX natgas ends mixed, Jan sets new high on cold.

text.p: NYMEX January Henry Hub natgas futures ended at new highs Friday in moderate trade, with forecasts for well-below normal temperatures over much of the nation driving the front of the complex up sharply.

January, which rallied late to a new high of $3.87 per million British thermal units, finished 32.2 cents higher at $3.851. February also hit a new benchmark of $3.47, then closed up by 20.3 cents at $3.415. Others ended mixed.
"We're up on (cold) weather, but it may be a bit overdone," said one East Coast trader, noting January has rallied almost 20 percent in the last four sessions.
Smith Barney forecaster Jon Davis expects successive waves of Arctic cold to keep U.S. temperatures east of the Rocky Mountains below-normal through the month.
With storage low and winter not yet begun, traders said they expected the bears to remain sidelined until milder weather returns.

Technical traders still pegged support in January in the $3.19 area, then $3.11 and $3.04. Resistance was now seen at the new contract high of $3.87, with major resistance at the all-time spot continuation high of $4.05.

In the cash, Gulf Coast prices climbed 20 cents Friday to near the $3.60 area. Midcontinent pipes were 10-15 cents higher in the mid-$3.40s. New York city gate gas was talked five to 10 cents higher at about $4.05-4.10.
The 12-month strip gained 5.7 cents to $3.562. NYMEX said 40,483 Hub contracts traded, up from Thursday's revised tally of 37,350.
NYMEX January Alberta natgas finished three cents higher at $1.68, while deferreds did not trade. NYMEX said two Alberta lots traded.
NYMEX Permian natgas again was untraded, with January settling unchanged at $3.25. Permian futures have not traded in 12 consecutive sessions.
On the KCBT, January ended 24 cents higher at $3.67, while deferreds closed up by two to 16.5 cents. The East/West spread widened by 8.2 cents to 18.1 cents (NYMEX premium).
